thread.title: Pop star Selena Gomez reveals she has the immune disorder lupus and underwent chemotherapy
thread.title_full: Pop star Selena Gomez reveals she has the immune disorder lupus and underwent chemotherapy

author: News Staff
title: Pop star Selena Gomez reveals she has the immune disorder lupus and underwent chemotherapy
text:
by The Associated Press Posted Oct 8, 2015 1:07 pm EDT FILE - In this Aug. 30, 2015 file photo, Selena Gomez arrives at the MTV Video Music Awards in Los Angeles. Gomez has revealed that she’s battling the debilitating immune system disorder lupus. “I was diagnosed with lupus, and I’ve been through chemotherapy,” the 23-year-old singer told Billboard magazine in an interview published Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Photo by Matt Sayles/Invision/AP, File) 
NEW YORK, N.Y. – Selena Gomez has revealed that she’s battling the debilitating immune system disorder lupus. 
“I was diagnosed with lupus, and I’ve been through chemotherapy,” the 23-year-old singer told Billboard magazine in an interview published Thursday. 
Gomez acted in “Wizards of Waverly Place” before becoming a pop star. She says she was treated in late 2013 and early 2014 after she cancelled the Asian and Australian legs of her Stars Dance tour. 
Lupus causes fibrous tissue and inflammation of internal organs, skin rashes and joint pain. It affects women nine times more than men. Organs affected by lupus include the kidneys, heart and lungs. 
Gomez’s song hits include “Come & Get It” and “Hit the Lights.” She has also appeared in the films “Rudderless” and “Spring Breakers.” Join the conversation Sign in to comment (not connected to your Insider Club login).
